vectorData.altText: 1. Bundles of subcortical white matter that connect the right and left cerebral hemispheres are called _____________ fibres.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That’s right!  Commissural fibres connect the two cerebral hemispheres across the midline.

Deep to the cerebral cortex is the subcortical white matter. It consists of axons connecting different areas of the nervous system. It can be classified as follows:
commissural fibres connect the two hemispheres across the midline; e.g. the corpus callosum (A) and anterior commissure
projection fibres carry information, in either direction, between a cerebral hemisphere and some lower centre (brainstem, spinal cord); e.g. the axons of the corona radiata (B) funnel together to get around or between medullary grey matter, forming the internal capsule (C) and external capsule (D), which coalesce to form, for instance, the cerebral peduncles (E).
association fibres connect different regions within a given hemisphere
From Neuroanatomy: An Atlas of Structures, Sections and Systems, 8e,  By D. E. Haines, © 2012, LWW.
